purpleculture_pinyin:
wō
nest; pit or hollow on the human body; lair; den; place; to harbor or shelter; to hold in check; to bend; classifier for litters and broods
гнездо; яма или впадина на теле человека; логово; логово; место; укрыться или укрыться; держать под контролем; согнуть; классификатор для пометов и выводков
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 窝)
Pictophonetic: 咼 indicates the sound; 穴 (cave) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
窩囊 [ wō nang ]: to feel vexed; annoyed; good-for-nothing; stupid and cowardly
窩囊廢 [ wō nang fèi ]: (coll.) spineless coward; wimp; a good-for-nothing
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 穴 [ xué ] cave, den, hole
    • 咼 [ guō ] to chat, to gossip, to jaw, to talk; mouth
heisig_chinese_memo: Your jawbone supports your mouth which is a hollow place to put food.
Ru_trainchinese:
wō: (сущ) гнездо, логовище; притон, логово (напр., для бандитов); местонахождение; предмет, напоминающий гнездо; углубление
wō: (графема/сч.слово) прятать, укрывать, давать убежище; выводок
wō: (глаг) сгибать; оставаться (дома); подавлять; держать без дела трудовые и материальные ресурсы
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the hole (穴) where the gossip (咼) lives is a cave
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The espophagus is an internal hole in the body which is like a hollow tube where food goes after you put it in your mouth.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " acupoint ", "咼" sound. " Nest " means the nest of birds, animals and insects. For example, Xiahoushen of the Tang Dynasty "Yong Beizhong embroidered shoes": "The toad hooks in the cloud and falls into the phoenix's nest, and the Yulang is intoxicated and rubs it." "Water Margin" Chapter 43: "Then Li Kui killed the four tigers in time Next to the tiger’s nest, he held the knife and looked at it again, lest there be a big bug.”

" Nest " also means a gathering place for people. Such as "Song History. "The Story of Shao Yong": "When he was old, he cultivated crops and only provided food and clothing. He was called "An Le Nest" because he was called Mr. An Le." Chapter 11 of "Jin Ping Mei Ci Hua": "It's a Fengyue Nest, Yinghua Village." A place occupied by a person or thing. For example, Chapter 17 of "The Scholars": "Said that he went to the market at the market, which occupied his nest of stalls."

" Nest " means hiding, hiding. For example, "Water Margin" Chapter 52: "You gang of grass thieves are hiding in the Liangshan moor, and I want to come and arrest you." Zhang Tingxiu escapes and saves his father": "Where is the stolen goods? To be honest, let you be fine."

" Nest " means things come into clusters. For example, Fan Chengda in the Southern Song Dynasty said in the "Snow Cocoon": "There are nests in the snow everywhere on the fence, and the Chai Jing is locked away from the guests." It also refers to bending and forming a ball. For example, Chapter 46 of "Journey to the West": "After a while, shave it off and send it out, nest in a ball, and stuff it in that cupboard."

" Nest " also refers to a recessed place. For example, Chapter 19 of "A Dream of Red Mansions": "Speaking of turning over, he slapped both hands, and then stretched out his hands to scratch under the ribs of Daiyu's diaphragmatic socket." Chapter 30 of "The Heroes of the Children": "Miss He Just before I was about to speak, the two dimples moved, blushing, and leaned into Girl Zhang's ear to say a few words."

" Wo " can also be used as a quantifier. For example, Chapter 31 of "Journey to the West": "But it said that the idiot was caught by a nest of monkeys, and he carried it and pulled it to pieces." There is a nest of messy grass on the side, a tutu sits on top of it with its knees crossed, and a roll of classics is placed in front of it. The package is placed on the left hand side, and it is leaning on a short wand wrapped in iron at both ends."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " point ", the sound of "咼". " Nest " means the nest of birds, animals and insects.
humanum_full_description:
從「穴」，「咼」聲。「窩」表示鳥獸昆蟲的巢穴。如唐代夏侯審〈詠被中繡鞋〉：「雲裡蟾鉤落鳳窩，玉郎沈醉也摩挲。」《水滸全傳》第43回：「那李逵時間殺了子母四虎，還又到虎窩邊，將著刀，復看了一遍，只恐還有大虫。」

　　「窩」又表示人的聚集地。如《宋史．邵雍傳》：「雍歲時耕稼，僅給衣食，名其居曰『安樂窩』，因自號安樂先生。」《金瓶梅詞話》第11回：「真是個風月窩，鶯花寨。」亦指人或物所佔的地方。如《儒林外史》第17回：「說在集上趕集，佔了他擺攤子的窩子。」

　　「窩」表示躲藏、藏匿。如《水滸全傳》第52回：「你這夥草賊，在梁山泊窩藏，我兀自要來勦捕你。」《醒世恒言．張廷秀逃生救父》：「贓物都窩頓在何處？從實細說，饒你刑罰。」

　　「窩」表示事物成團成簇。如南宋范成大〈曬繭〉：「隔籬處處雪成窩，牢閉柴荊斷客過。」又指把事物弄彎、弄成團。如《西游記》第46回：「須臾，剃下髮來，窩作一團，塞在那櫃腳紇絡裏。」

　　「窩」亦指凹陷的地方。如《紅樓夢》第19回：「說著翻身起來，將兩隻手呵了兩口，便伸手向黛玉膈肢窩內兩肋下亂撓。」《兒女英雄傳》第30回：「何小姐纔要開口，兩個酒窩兒一動，把臉一紅，湊到張姑娘耳畔說了幾句。」

　　「窩」還可用作量詞。如《西遊記》第31回：「卻說那獃子被一窩猴子捉住了，扛抬扯拉，把一件直裰子揪破。」《三遂平妖傳》第10回：「門外茅簷邊側鋪著一窩亂草，一個頭陀盤著雙膝在上打坐，面前擺一卷經典，左首安放包裹，倚著一根兩頭鐵裹的齊眉短棒兒。」
humanum_short_description: 從「穴」，「咼」聲。「窩」表示鳥獸昆蟲的巢穴。
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
窩 (Simplified: 窝)
Pinyin: wō
English Definition: nest; pit or hollow on the human body; lair; den; place; to harbor or shelter; to hold in check; to bend; classifier for litters and broods
Total strokes: 14; Radical: 穴
Pictophonetic: 咼 indicates the sound; 穴 (cave) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿱ Above to below
    • 穴 [ xué ] cave, den, hole
    • 咼 [ guō ] to chat, to gossip, to jaw, to talk; mouth
Example Words:
窩囊 [ wō nang ]: to feel vexed; annoyed; good-for-nothing; stupid and cowardly
窩囊廢 [ wō nang fèi ]: (coll.) spineless coward; wimp; a good-for-nothing

From " acupoint", " 咼" sound. " Nest" means the nest of birds, animals and insects. For example, Xiahoushen of the Tang Dynasty "Yong Beizhong embroidered shoes": "The toad hooks in the cloud and falls into the phoenix's nest, and the Yulang is intoxicated and rubs it." "Water Margin" Chapter 43: "Then Li Kui killed the four tigers in time Next to the tiger’s nest, he held the knife and looked at it again, lest there be a big bug.” " Nest" also means a gathering place for people. Such as "Song History. "The Story of Shao Yong": "When he was old, he cultivated crops and only provided food and clothing. He was called "An Le Nest" because he was called Mr. An Le." Chapter 11 of "Jin Ping Mei Ci Hua": "It's a Fengyue Nest, Yinghua Village." A place occupied by a person or thing. For example, Chapter 17 of "The Scholars": "Said that he went to the market at the market, which occupied his nest of stalls." " Nest" means hiding, hiding. For example, "Water Margin" Chapter 52: "You gang of grass thieves are hiding in the Liangshan moor, and I want to come and arrest you." For example, Fan Chengda in the Southern Song Dynasty said in the "Snow Cocoon": "There are nests in the snow everywhere on the fence, and the Chai Jing is locked away from the guests." 窩字的基本解释

窩
wō
见“窝”。

窩字的汉语字典释义

[①]［wō］
［《字彙》烏禾切］
“窝1”的繁体字。
(1)鸟兽、昆虫栖止处。
(2)借指人的安身处。
(3)指坏人聚集、活动的场所。
(4)比喻人或物所在或所占的位置。
(5)物成团成簇。
(6)指事物集中处。
(7)凹陷处。
(8)藏；躲避。
(9)隐匿；包庇。
(10)蜷伏。
(11)陷入。
(12)卷；撮。
(13)折转。
(14)盖；围裹。
(15)郁积。
(16)量词。用于成团成簇的东西。
(17)量词。用于一胎所生的或一次孵出的动物。
(18)用同“屙”。
(19)用同“兀”。参见“窩的”。

窩字的康熙字典解释

【午集下】【穴字部】　窩； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页866第60
【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?烏禾切，音倭。穴居也。本作䆧，或作窩。藏也，窟也。【字彙】凡別墅獨處皆名窩。宋邵雍有安樂窩。

窩字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
窩字的起名意思

暂无。

nest
Basic explanation of words
nest
wō
See "Nest".
nest
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［wō］
["Words" Wuhe Cut]
Traditional characters of "窝1".
(1) The place where birds, animals and insects reside.
(2) By referring to a person's home.
(3) Refers to a place where bad people gather and engage in activities.
(4) It is a metaphor for the location or position occupied by a person or thing.
(5) The objects form clusters.
(6) Refers to the place where things are concentrated.
(7) Depression.
(8) To hide; to hide.
(9) Concealment; shelter.
(10) Crouching.
(11) Fall into.
(12) Volume; summary.
(13) Turn around.
(14) Cover; wrap around.
(15) Stagnation.
(16) Quantifiers. Used for things in clusters.
(17) Quantifiers. Used for animals born in one litter or hatched at one time.
(18) Use the same as "屙".
(19) Use the same as "wu". See "Nestal".
nest
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Afternoon Set 2] [Acupoint Word Department] 　wo; Kangxi strokes: 14; page number: page 866 60
[Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Zheng Yun]? Wuhe cut, sound widow. Cave dwellers too. This is a 冧, or a nest. Tibet also, cave also. [Vocabulary] Every villa alone is a famous nest. Song Shaoyong had a peaceful nest.
